revised_title: Naval Engineering Systems in the 1980s: Future Developments and Challenges
tldr: This article discusses the future of engineering systems in naval ships, focusing on the 1980s. It covers topics such as propulsion, auxiliary, hull, and hotel services, as well as the operational and functional requirements, technical developments, and economic and environmental influences that will shape these systems. The author also explores the challenges and trends in automation, manpower, pollution, and industrial connections that will impact naval engineering during this time period.
